column3: News;Phnom Penh: A------ group of eight people have been detained in connection with illegal arms trading
column4: terrorism and other subversive activities.------The 8 suspects were arrested In Kampong Speu
column5: Kampot and Pursat in late September 2018. Police were sent to court on September 30
column6: 2018.------The eight arrested suspects------According to the report
column8: were hidden by suspects on land in Phnom Penh
column10: Kampot province and Boeng Sdok village
column14: a suspect confessed that his group wanted to revolt against the government and seek financial resources.------Lieutenant General Chay Kim Khoeun
column15: Deputy Chief of Police and Deputy Chief of Staff
column16: told Rasmei Kampuchea on the morning of October 1 There were eight detained people and 28 guns. And there will be subsequent arrests.  Gen. Y Sok Khy
column17: director of the Ministry of Interior’s Department of Counterterrorism and Transnational Crime
column18: stated that eight people had been sent To the Phnom Penh Municipal Court.------Meanwhile
column19: Phnom Penh Municipal Court spokesman Ly Sovan told Rasmey Kampuchea on the afternoon of October 1 that the prosecution had chrged all eight people for unauthorized access to Armed Groups
column22: and for joining armed groups under Articles 485
column24: and 7 488 of the Penal Code. And the case has been referred to the Investigating Judge to proceed with the proceedings------http://www.rasmeinews.com/%E1%9E%94%E1%9F%89%E1%9E%BC%E1%9E%9B%E1%9E%B7%E1%9E%9F%E2%80%8B%E1%9E%85%E1%9E%B6%E1%9E%94%E1%9F%8B%E1%9E%81%E1%9F%92%E1%9E%9B%E1%9E%BD%E1%9E%93%E2%80%8B%E1%9E%98%E1%9E%93%E1%9E%BB%E1%9E%9F%E1%9F%92/------ ------ ------ ------
